text.div:
SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonVS ValueSet

An explanation of why the observation was not made (or ordered), i.e., why test was not ordered, or why a question was not asked. Since an observation is really a type of procedure, reasons that an observation was not carried out are similar to reasons any procedure might not be carried out.

name: SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonVS ValueSet
title: SHR ObservationNotMadeReasonVS ValueSet
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: An explanation of why the observation was not made (or ordered), i.e., why test was not ordered, or why a question was not asked. Since an observation is really a type of procedure, reasons that an observation was not carried out are similar to reasons any procedure might not be carried out.

concept.display: The question or data element is not applicable, or based on other answers, no answer to this question is required.
The test or observation is contraindicated, i.e., the subject is intolerant or at risk of an adverse reaction if subjected to the test or observation.
The observation has made previously, or a previous test result is available, a new  test or observation would be redundant.
The observation would be too costly.
